summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to MoneyGram International, Inc., dated August 16, 2019, commanding the production of financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena seeks all available information on money transfers and money order purchases associated with Maxwell's identifiers, as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal criminal statutes including sex trafficking and coercion/enticement. The document includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all financial records (money transfers, money orders) associated with her name, date of birth, addresses, phone, and email.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for MoneyGram
events.description: The subpoena commands MoneyGram International, Inc. to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, unless records are produced to the FBI by this date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to MoneyGram as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY

New York, NY (address associated with Ghislaine Maxwell)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active federal grand jury investigation into suspected felonies, specifically citing violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The investigation is targeting Ghislaine Maxwell's financial transactions through MoneyGram, seeking detailed records of money transfers and money orders linked to her personal identifiers.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested MoneyGram not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality and prevent interference.
The subpoena was issued in August 2019, indicating active investigative steps regarding Maxwell's finances approximately two years before her arrest and trial.
